metadata.title: CVE-2020-25661 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 20.04 LTS (focal) - negligible
metadata.description: A Red Hat only CVE-2020-12351 regression issue was found in the way theLinux kernel's Bluetooth implementation handled L2CAP packets with A2MPCID. This flaw allows a remote attacker in an adjacent range to crash thesystem, causing a denial of service or potentially executing arbitrary codeon the system by sending a specially crafted L2CAP packet. The highestthreat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality, integrity, as well assystem availability.

criterions.comment: linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-raspi').
